Reviews.Title: “Horrific customer service”
Reviews.Author: Olivia500
Reviews.Content: Booked (AND PAID FOR) A two bedroom, but upon arrival I was told that we were getting a one bedroom - that was all they had available. For three adults and two children! The issue has not been resolved. Parking is horrible, front desk staff is RUDE and didn't care about the fact that a one bedroom wasn't going to work. To make matters worse - the check in process took 35 minutes and we were the only ones checking in. They send you to get "pool bracelets" but truthfully this is just to give you their sales pitch. Rooms basically suck. The bed is like a slab of cement. No mirrors, and not clean. The elevator was broke down and we were staying on the fourth floor. Hallways are filthy. I honestly feel that what they did to us should be against the law. They are dirty crooks.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Joenuzz11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here wit an exchange from our timeshare. The place is nice. It is older but nice. The pool area is fabulous. Great pools, kiddie pool, hot tub ad bar. The pools are nice and deep so even dads stay entertained. The indoor pool is another story. Feels like a dungeon in there. The pool isn't heated and the AC is blasting. Water was very cold. The rooms are nice but only one couch. Not enough if you have more then two adults. Rooms are cleaned to the minimum standard. No dirt or trash that is very noticeable but you can just tell that the rooms aren't cleaned from top to bottom when they are vacated. But the place is nice. I have stayed in way worse before. I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “A liitle disappointing”
Reviews.Author: yankeelover1987
Reviews.Content: grand seas resort 7/28/2012 After reading hundreds of reviews we were very skeptical about this resort. We are a family of 4 stayed in a 2 bedroom unit on the 5 floor. Great view to the ocean and pools. Room was very comfortable for all of us. Loved the location could walk to all stores and restaurants. I booked this trip through interval according to its rating" Premier", well the only thing that makes the grand seas a premier resort is its location. The views are beautiful, beach is clean and close. Unfortunately I believe this hotel draws many undesirables on the weekends. Our room was not as clean as I would have liked, the hallways and elevators were dirty and smelled of beer. The outdoor pool areas were meticulously cleaned. One thing I noticed was anyone from the beach area can come in and use the resort, there are no security to prevent outsiders to enter. Also there were never enough lounge chairs in the pool areas because many people reserve them with towels for the day and never return to use them. As far as our room, I feel they skimp on cleaning. The rooms really need to be thoroughly cleaned maintenance needs to wipe down the walls and windows, vacuum the dirt behind all furniture. The kitchen was small but appliances were clean. Overall We had a good vacation. Just the grand Seas needs to improve on its maintenance and security, then it would really be a premier resort. Interval needs to re-rate this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be re rated”
Reviews.Author: allangroom78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a resort in Orlando and chose grand seas resort for our 2 nd week . On arrival we found this to appear not a five star resort. exterior looked like a motel. I nearly fell through the railings in the car park on to the beach.on check in, all paper work given was A photo copy (not what you would expect from a five star establishment)the resort felt run down.we checked in and checked out all within 1 hour. We didn't even get as far as the room. The rating system is guide to hotel quality, I feel we have been miss lead. We rebooked into our original resort.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Mlevis
Reviews.Content: One year it is fine this year it was a huge disaster. Floors filthy all along walls, Cherry stems and pits out in the open, fridge and dishwasher rusted on the inside. Sales asks what problems you are having and then say we do not want to hear that just stop talking. Only saving grace this week was the front desk. Everyone else just does not give a damn and should be fired.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: juliehailey
Reviews.Content: Im very picky. Spent 7 months researching hotels in daytona. True front desk staff are not extremely friendly. Bill the guy that tries to sell the time shares is very rude and will call and wake you up early in the morning after you already decline the time share appt. But the room was clean,beautiful. We did not cook in kitchen because it was rusty appliances but pools were clean,tiki bar and live music was great. Room decor is beautiful. Resort 4 times the price further down in daytona was discusting dirty, so dirty i wouldnt sleep on their bed sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived July 27th - July 30th”
Reviews.Author: sebrina@hampton
Reviews.Content: I was kind of nervous upon arrival. Didn't care for the parking area. They lied about you are guaranteed your own parking space. The rooms were very nice and clean. Didn't see any bugs like some reviewers said. The Gilligan Restaurant was great!!! Only problem I have that I have not received my refund back for deposit. I keep getting the run around. Its has been 7 days and no result. Sebrina @hampton, Ga

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penny B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was working on some updates and painting but it was outdated. The night time taco bar was great. The front office staff overall were friendly. The timeshare desk staff were really friendly of course. Having 2 pools helped to have enough space for most people. Access to the beach was great. They have a sand volleyball net set up right on the beach next to the entrance to the beach that was fun. the miniature golf course looked great for little kids. The outside bar was nice by the pool. Just the rooms were a little outdated. Clean overall. For the right price I would probably stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, nice beach, large dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: pattio1259
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, which is actually 3 rooms connected. Lots of space, 3 bathrooms, 2 kitchens. Unfortunately, the rooms need some real TLC. Ironically, I had read some of the reviews before we went, saying that the guests feet were turning black from the carpets, so I brought my slippers. My daughter and her friend complained about this very thing. They were a little annoyed that I did not give them the " heads up ". I honestly did not think that teenagers cared. The room towels were barely passable, but the " beach towels" were horrendous. I actually went out and bought some, knowing I wouldn't take them back on the plane, they were that bad. The pool was very nice though, never had a problem getting a chaise loung, kept immaculate. Pool bar was good, grill food was not, but lots of good restaurants within easy walk. Starbucks right across the street was nice for morning coffee. Though I loved the pool, I would probably NOT go back unless I heard that some major work was done on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for any thief!!”
Reviews.Author: TxFamily2012
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at The Grand Seas Resort in Daytona, Florida because it boasted of beautiful beach & it had the right number of bedrooms for our family & since we were staying for almost 2 weeks we knew we would need enough room. I have to say, the beach was amazing & the hotel was right on the beach. We did not mind not having a balcony at all & we did have plenty of space for everyone to have room & not be up in everybody's business. We didn't even mind the fact that they didn't have housekeeping every day ... They did offer clean towels & sheets every day. We knew it was a rome share & were prepared to be bothered to purchase one. What we did have an issue with was safety. The lack of security & the fact that management was so out of touch with what was really going on in and on their property. There was an incident where a young adult male (24 yrs old) was soliciting young girls (14-16 yrs old) and our daughter happened to be a selected target. That didn't work out well for him at all!! Dad got ahold of him & took care is the situation. Came to find out that our daughter was the 3rd victim in 2 days!! We did notify security & they did nothing. Then we were robbed in our room. It was an inside job. They took cash & prescription meds. That had been just a few hours that I had not locked up my purse in the safe while we were at the pool. We did tell the front desk & they did nothing. Police said that we needed to get out of that hotel immediately!! We then learned that one of our credit cards had fraudulent charges on it at a Florida establishment. The bank quickly handled the issue. And we again notified the front desk & requested to speak to management & we were NEVER contacted by anyone to follow up. Keep in mind, my family had spent almost 10 days at this resort at this point. We were ending our vacation & got out as quickly as we could. We did not feel safe knowing someone had entered our room with either a key made by the front desk or another means of overriding the electric key-door lock. Bottom line ... No matter how great the location is ... If you can't feel safe there it will ruin what time you do have left ... We moved onto another beach & hotel altogether. Had a perfect end to our long planned 2 week beach vacation. I will never recommend this resort/hotel to anyone & will discourage them from staying here at all. And we are now headed home to Texas!!

Reviews.Title: “The Strategic Business Analyst”
Reviews.Author: DanDib
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get away for a few days for a little bit of R&R. We can all use a quick break now and then. Statistically speaking there is no where near enough parking to accommodate the size of the resort. For a resort that charges these prices the focus should always be on customer service. There were no staff to greet you as you pull up to the front door, nor was there room to turn around. I walk into the resort and immediately there was already a confrontation going on about an incorrect reservation. Instead of empathizing with the guest the front desk just shook their head and continued to argue with the guest. Either the front desk personnel were not trained properly or the owner does not care. I then had to find where the carts were, find my car, unload it in the pouring rain, and attempt to get this cart into my room to unload it. I was also surprised to find that all the studios didi not have a balcony, as advertised. There were paint chips falling from the ceiling at the window, obviously in need of repair. The mattress was old and sagged in the middle. I had made two more trips to the front desk for information only to find confrontations with dissatisfied guests each time. There were plenty of staff around but no one would help with any issues and often speak in their own foreign language during one of the front desk confrontations. This resort could be so much better than what it is-but then again who would pick this up but a strategic business analyst. If you want me to do an analysis of your business contact me at thestrategicbusinessanalyst@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Indifferent staff, View of the Ocean only redeeming point”
Reviews.Author: smartimom
Reviews.Content: We are finishing up our stay at this resort tomorrow, and I want to share my thoughts while they are fresh. Front desk personnel were extremely rude and unaccommodating when I just called down to complain about the piercing alarm sound that has gone off in the room every 2 minutes for the last half hour. Apparently, maintenance is testing the alarm system and they "can do nothing about it" what was extra insulting is the glee with which they say "my pleasure" at the end of every call whether it was pleasant for the customer or not! This is our last day here, and boy are we glad to be headed home tomorrow! Upon arrival, we were permitted to check in an hour early as our room was ready.That was nice. We were informed that we had to see the concierge to get our "pool bracelets". This is their ruse to get you to go face to face with the guy who will attempt to schedule you to attend a breakfast sales presentation. There is no real breakfast (donuts and coffee) and the presentation takes more than an hour. We went for the free "sand dollars" (resort credit for meals). The vacation package/plan they are selling is a big ripoff, but the little restaurant, Gilligans, has a good breakfast special and the food was yummy (and the Gilligans staff is very, very nice), and you can use your sand dollars there if you choose to endure the sales pitch to get them. FYI- nobody seems to be checking for those bracelets at the pool. In fact, they do not seem to care much about whatever goes on around here. The room was old, floors were dirty as others have observed, no hangers in the closet (we had to call 3x to get some), fixtures old, dust and other peoples' odd junk (hair ties, books) found behind furniture. No garbage disposal, whirlpool jets in the tub spewed black gunk. Brought plenty of lysol products and decided that we are basically camping out. The view is awesome from the upper floors, almost worth the grief of dealing with the rude and unhelpful staff and the sub-par accommodations. The one day our room was to be cleaned was Wednesday, but staff came in on Tuesday while we were at breakfast. Our belongings were tossed into corners, floor was mopped, but fold away bed was left open, so a large bit of the floor was left unmopped. Strong smell of bleach in the room was the first tipoff that they had been by. We were not pleased. We have stayed at many different places via timeshare exchanges, but this was by far the worst both with regard to the facility and the staff. Daytona is great, come on down here anytime and you will have fun- just stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews paint it.”
Reviews.Author: Ann194
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the resort after reading the reviews. It is a great location, right on the beach. They do not provide beach chairs or umbrellas. There is shopping right across street where you can buy cheap beach supplies. We stayed in a 1 bedroom with ocean view. The microwave had some rust. It is very difficult to maintain things on the beach with the salt spray. This is very family oriented. They have 2 outdoor pools, 1 baby pool, 1 indoor pool, 2 outdoor hot tubs, I indoor pool 1 indoor hot tub. Restaurant on site is not bad for a meal if you don't want to go out. They have daily specials that are reasonable. This is not a Ritz Carlton, do not stay here if that's what you are looking for! For the money, it is a great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Going down hill”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 years ago, lots of activities,this stay there was none. Seems new owners are letting this great resort go down. Too bad, great location with lots of maintenance issues

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed in Interval”
Reviews.Author: Paula F
Reviews.Content: Just like some of the interviews which gave the true description of the Grand Seas Resort in Daytona Beach, we were highly disappointed. This was my first time using Interval. I am going to write this company a letter asking if they ever do check out these places at all? The pictures in the catalog we viewed looked so good, but the reality was totally different. Not only no balconies, but no screens either on any of the windows, and they were dirty. When looking up from the pool, people had their windows open and the drapes were blown outside by the breeze because of no screen. Very tacky, looked like a real 'seedy' place from below. It looks like it has not been renovated since at least 1950 with old, old appliances, the stove was rusty in parts, one burner was broken and did not work, and the oven had not been cleaned in a very long time, the floor molding was coming off and rusted at the corners, a bad uncomfortable mattress pad on the small Murphy bed. On and the bathroom had one small mirror and no mirrors at all in the room. I would never use that bathtub as a jacuzzi spa. The vents were black, looked dirty. I wish I had looked on this site of trip advisor before I booked. And those who said this so-called resort was great, either do not expect anything at all or must work for this resort in some capacity. The only saving grace was the beautiful view of the ocean, nice flat screen TV, and the small restaurant/bar attached was okay and the food quite nice and reasonably priced. But all in all it, will go down as 1 on a scale from 2 to 10; 10 being best. I hope we never have to experience a dumpy place like this again. In the paperwork I had, there was a fee to change rooms. As I peeked inside at other rooms when in passing,,,, I saw that they looked pretty much the same. SHAME ON YOU, INTERVAL for not taking better care of your members (who pay huge $$$$s to belong to your membership) in this time share!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: St. Clair Shores, Michigan, United States
Reviews.Title: “No Complaints at ALL!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Seas resort last week (April 8-14). The only way you could write a negative review of this place is if you are nitpicking at every little thing! This place is great. To all the reviews saying the floor is dirty... well ANY place located RIGHT ON the beach is going to have sand on the floors! no matter how well you clean there is no avoiding it! Its part of staying on the ocean! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in every way... going above and beyond to help us! One guy even used his own internet to find a location for us on his break... not many people would do that where we are from. The area in general is very laid back, the people are interesting, fun, sooo friendly and non judgemental! We LOVE daytona beach/ormond beach! This resort is not right "downtown" near all the activities, boardwalk, bars, etc, but its right down the street, we even walked it a couple times which is a beautiful walk along the beach! The buses run frequently up and down atlantic so we didnt even rent a car and we got everywhere we wanted to go and more! We actually liked the fact that this resort is a little further north because the beaches arent even close to as crowded its more peaceful and relaxing! No there arent balconies on the beach side, but we got a room that had a balcony type walk in the hallway.. which was almost as good... and the view from our room is amazing!! The entire wall is a window! There was plenty of space and included everything we needed for a week stay. I wouldnt say its a 5 star resort but its pretty darn nice, and only a snob would complain about this resort! We werent bothered at all about a timeshare, and when we were asked once they left us alone aterwards. If you dont use the internet they dont charge you the resort fee. We didnt see one single bug in our room just amazing and beautiful beaches. The pools are clean and beautiful, it would be such a great place for a family with the waterslides and playground and mini golf. We really liked the hot tubs outside which are great on a chilly night. The bar is nicely located and friendly. The food at gilligans is GREAT and not too expensive, and is nicely decorated and modern. Their specials are awesome. Overall we had a GREAT vacation here and if given the opportunity, would definately stay again. A couple recommendations in ormond beach.. Peppers mexican grill about a mile north on atlantic and also Artistic Soul tattoos a couple miles north in ormond beach (we got tattoos while we were there). They are amazing artists and the friendliest, cleanest, most accomodating people ever! We finally found them after checking out the rediculous 'flash' tattoo places in daytona beach. And thank god we did! If we ever return to florida we will be making a trip out there to see them no matter how far the drive! Overall we definately recommend Grand Seas resort and the daytona/orm ond beach area overall!! We didnt want to come home!

Reviews.Title: “In Need of an Update”
Reviews.Author: Kathy611c
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent a week at this resort. Upon arrival, we were disapointed to find out that they do not have balconies. The rooms are oceanfront with a floor to ceiling window that opens, which atleast helps, but a balcony would have been wonderful. The furniture is old, the resort was clean except for the floor. Our feet were always dirty! The floor is tile, you walk around barefoot through the whole resort so you can't expect not to track in dirt & sand. We did sweep, but it really didn't help. The murphy bed was very comfortable. Luckily we didn't need to use the sleep sofa because it was awful.The resort is located across the street from a shopping area that includes a Publix, Bealls (+outlet), Dollar Tree, Walgreens & a couple small restaurants. This was very handy as you can walk to shop. Ocean Walk area is about 2miles down the road. When you are on the beach, be leary of people in golf carts. They are trying to sell you on a new vacation plan. We went and it was awful! They were not going to take NO for an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Seas Resort Daytona looking shabby”
Reviews.Author: selake92
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Grand Seas resort in Daytona and found the place in need of renovation. Peeling, chipped paint, stained tile grout, rusting appliances, rusting around elevator doors, furniture in poor shape, even stained plastic toilet seats. The location is great on the beach with shopping right across the street but just no where near the premier resort advertised. Ours was a timeshare trade through Interval International and we were very disappointed that Interval even continues to list this as an eqivalent exchange with our home resort. Just not up to the standards we've come to expect in an interval exchange. Also resented that they had no chairs or boogie boards to take onto the beach. We could rent chairs for $35 a day or a boogie board for $15. I went across the street and bought a boogie board for $12. The staff was good but the place needs to be renovated and they should have a few chairs and toys to lend.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Seas Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kris14813
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the rooms on their website are definitely not what they look like! However, the room was OK. The bed pulled down from the wall and behind it was rusty and dirty but it was really comfortable. The floors were sandy but we had the door open and with the breeze it should be expected. I know in other reviews people complained about this but the cleaning staff was always available if needed. We had all the necessities (refrig, stove/oven, microwave, pots, dishes, etc) and a little patio of our own. We were on the ground floor and it was noisey early in the morning but we were right in front of the pool. The pools were huge and the tiki bar was super cool. They had music one night with a DJ and had an 80s party. It would be a perfect place for small children with a nice playground and kiddie pool. The staff was very friendly, the reception area was very nice and the daily specials at the restaurant were great. The specials were available at the tiki bar too. We would definitely stay there again because of the price and take our grand children with us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Rita T
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort to find almost a 30 minute wait at check in. This did not bother us too much as we knew it was spring break. However, once we got checked in and went up to our room our key did not work. We had to go back down and the lady at the front desk gave us new keys. We went back up to the room and they key still did not work. There were two maintenance workers that met us at the door and said the key was not going to work and they had told the front desk this. Maintenance used their master key and opened the room to a room packed to the ceiling with extra furniture, filing cabinets, etc. We went back down to the front desk and the lady who checked us in could not even be bothered to come out of the back office to apologize. In fact, there was no apology from any of the staff. We finally received keys that worked to room that was not clean. We were supposed to have a room with two queen beds and ended up a murphy bed and a pull out couch. We didn't complain. We kept the room. We only stayed one night in this hotel and during the one night we stayed we found an empty box of condoms, a half empty bottle of vodka in the freezer, woman's toiletry trash on the floor in the bathroom, and a ball cap in the murphy bed. In the bathroom there was hair all over the floor. We had to put towels on the floor and scoot around so we did not touch the floor. There would have been absolutely no way we would have stayed for more than one night in this hotel. It is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with this resort!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry L
Reviews.Content: My family had the best vacation at Grand Seas this week. The resort staff very friendly and this truly is a family resort . We have already made a reservation for our next vacation. My family loved it so much we just purchased a two bedroom with the resort. This truly was a great experience for my children!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I wholeheartedly agree”
Reviews.Author: nocnurse1966
Reviews.Content: Interval International also led us astray during the fall of 2011 by booking us in this resort and trying to pass it off as a "premier" resort. I am convinced that they save the most horrible suites for the Interval customers!! We also had a dirty unit. We had to go to Walmart to buy cleaning supplies to clean the room before we would sit on anything. The refrigerator was rusted out and covered up by a poor coat of latex paint on the outside. Water damaged cabinets in the kitchen were glaring along with rusted out dish racks in the dishwasher. Not sure who gets balconies, but our room had windows with no balcony. The outside of the resort was in a nasty state of disarray and the staff were rude. I wrote a letter to Interval upon our return and just received a mild "gee that's too bad" - Please think twice about staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Totally misrepresentated by Interval International”
Reviews.Author: JVCNP
Reviews.Content: Compared to our past experiences w/ Interval resorts (particularly Boston Custom House and Royal Mayan), this "resort" was extremely disappointing and we would suggest that Interval remove it from their inventory until such time that there are major renovations/upgrades and it is brought up to the standards expected by Interval members. We had initially booked an efficiency unit but declined the one assigned when we realized that the Murphy bed was approximately 15 inches off the floor and there was paint spattered on the kitchen floor. We were told that all efficiency units have Murphy beds - a fact not noted on our confirmation page. We were told by the resort that we could "upgrade" for $150 for the week. After phoning Interval to complain, we were advised that we would receive a waiver for the next time we exchange. My husband and I agreed and were given the keys to a one bedroom unit. Upon entering, we noted a minimum of TEN DEAD INSECTS on the floor plus TWO dead insects on the headboard of the bed. Again we returned to the lobby to decline the second room and were given keys to Rm 5010. After nearly 90 minutes of being hassled, we were finally in a marginal but more acceptable room. The Grand Seas is more of a glorified six story motel - the building, inside and out, is poorly maintained. Outside, we noted chipping paint, rusting around elevator openings, filthy elevator doors, paint spatters everywhere, broken glass and other debris by the steps leading to the beach which were present for our entire six day stay, trash containers that were full for several days at a time plus incessant country music in the lobby and on the ground floor. Inside Rm 5010, we noted chipped floor tiles, stained grout, dirty bathrooms, dirty soap dish in bath/shower, stained toilet seat lid, dirty hand prints on all doors, furniture that was chipped, wall that had paper/sheetrock peeled off/paint missing, windows that needed washing, stained seat cushion on furniture, and stains on curtains in living and bedrooms. Another major negative is that the Grand Seas does not allow anyone to move lounge chairs from the pool to the beach area and one would have to rent such lounge chairs from a vendor at an absurd cost of $35/day per chair. There are several positives to this resort – the young women who helped us to obtain a more suitable room were pleasant and the maintenance worker arrived within 10 minutes to repair the door lock. Although there are no balconies on the upper floors, the view of the beach was gorgeous from our 5th floor room and the location was convenient to grocery store, restaurants, museum. However, it is laughable that there are numerous Interval plaques on the wall behind the main desk in the lobby that proclaim the Grand Seas a “Premier” and “5 Star Resort”.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the entire family to enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: Felicia F
Reviews.Content: The Grand Seas Resort is a well placed retreat, right across the street from the local grocery store. I was pleased to see that our room was spotless when we entered and well maintained. The resort includes three pools which were all very nice, although there are plenty of children running around each. The afternoon activities around the bar were a great plus to the stay and livened things up downstairs, and after pool hours everything was very calm and quiet. Overall, lit was a very enjoyable stay, and also great lunch a the restaruants.

Reviews.Title: “Great family fun for Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Dw1479
Reviews.Content: Grand Seas in Daytona was a fabulous experience for the whole family! There were 3 pools and a kiddie pool. The slide down rock work was fantastic. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly. The restaurant was delicious and had fabulous specials! Though there are no balconies, but the floor to ground window made up for it and was safe for my small children!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie W
Reviews.Content: We went on vacation and when I chose to stay here I was a little scared from reading all reviews but our room was on 5th floor and besides the floors being a little sandy which come on you are on beach the 2 bedroom condo was very clean and beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Great resort back in day!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey1977
Reviews.Content: I booked the resort based on my time share group! Ill never trust them till I check with trip advisor. There website made it look better than reality! It was nice to be close to ocean but it needs alot of TLC. Also watch when you make reservations make sure if you have more two in your group they dont try to stick you in a studio room. The bed pulls out of wall and the bide away is right next to it! Reserve at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: shannon s
Reviews.Content: Room smelled so strongly of bleach that it burned your nose hairs. Poor lighting at night. Front desk treated us like criminals when our room key would not work. Would never go back. There were also roaches. No security.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty place”
Reviews.Author: ChuckS160
Reviews.Content: Grand Seas Resorts 1-7-2012 to 1-12-2012 When we arrived we were greeted warmly and told that they would charge a $50 deposit to our credit card that day. We thought that was unusual. Our first room had a kitchen that was extremely small and to our way of thinking unusable. The television blanked out repeatedly. The sink does not have a garbage disposal. They do not provide filters for the coffee maker so that had to be our first trip to the store. Since we had exchanged a Marriott Barony Beach property for this through Interval International we were very disappointed with the Grand Seas. The Grand Seas is only 25% of the property we deposited for the exchange. We arrived late and didn’t check everything out before falling into a very uncomfortable bed. In the morning we discovered ants every where in the master bedroom. We then moved down to the second floor to a unit that had a much better kitchen, still without a garbage disposal. 3 of the 4 outlets in the kitchen did not work and one of the outlets did not have a cover on it. A call to the front desk got that corrected. After walking around the room for a while, in our bare feet and socks, we discovered that the floors are so dirty that the bottoms of our feet turned black. It was disgusting. We called to have the floors washed. Really!!! The bottom cover of the refrigerator was missing and we had a wonderful view of a rusting gaping hole. I don’t know how fast things rust down here but this looks like it has been through a few hard winters driving the streets of Boston. The exhaust fan vents were caked with dust, the kind that you get if you don’t clean them for several months. Housekeeping came and cleaned our room. They say they washed the floor but our feet still turn black when we walk from the bedroom to the kitchen and then to the living room. When they cleaned the exhaust vent in the shower they left black foot prints on the bottom of the shower. We had to wash the shower before we could use it. The television in the second bedroom did not work. They came and changed it out and couldn’t get that television to work either. I don’t expect them to come back voluntarily. Internet service is very problematic. It keeps dropping out. It goes from excellent service to no service over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Drab and Depressing”
Reviews.Author: JoanBW
Reviews.Content: This once was a lovely place, but today is drab and depressing. It was slightly seedy feeling. There are many conveniences around the resort, such as a supermarket and restaurants, but the accomodations don't live up to modern standards. Slightly dirty, group of mentally challenged adults living there, staff was friendly but poorly informed about the area. On top of everything else, they keep a sales staff there to try to sell you a "travel club" using high pressure techniques and lying. Avoid this like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Dianeq_11
Reviews.Content: The Grand Seas seems to have been one of those older 60's style hotels that they are in the process of renovating. A great deal of money has been spent on the pool deck, ammenities, bedding, curtains etc. The rooms were nice and clean except for the floors. I don't think they mop them regularly. The staff was extremely accomodating and friendly. There was wi-fi in the rooms but coverage is sporatic. BEWARE of the "presentation" they offer you at check-in is a rip-off. They promised a $50 gift card for local restaurants and a weeks vacation or $100 gift card for local restaurants. At the end of the presentation there was NOTHING!!!! While they promised to deliver the card before we left no one produced the gift cards. While the resort claims they have nothing to do with the vacation club they direct you to their desk upon check-in. Talk about bad PR!!! Overall a good experience, loved the beach just stay away from the presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BohanDonner
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be avoided. I do not even know where to start! The room was very dirty. We complained about the bugs we were told we could spend $30 to have the room cleaned. There was a pill capsule on the kitchen window sill that we repeatedly asked to have removed. We threw the pill away after two weeks. Furniture is extremely worn. Constant phone messages to sell some type of cruise program. We empty our own grabage and took our towel to the laundry daily. When we turned bathroom light on in middle of night you could watch bugs scatter. Main desk staff was polite but really did not want to hear complaints. None of the employees seemed happy and absolutely no one said hello or good morning unless spoken to first. The only plus was the Grille located in the hotel. The wait staff in the Grille was very friendly and helpful. We were unfortunately at this hotel, not a resort by any standard, for two weeks. We will not go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean view!”
Reviews.Author: UpNorthWoman
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Interval. Even though we did not have a balcony (4th floor), the window opened up and we had a magnificent view of the ocean. Staff is very friendly and try to be helpful. One complaint is that our bedroom window was next to the hallway light and shone into our room; the closed blinds did not do the trick. The hallway light must have been on a timer; staff were unable to turn it off. Their solution was to give us a thick blanket to cover up our window from the inside, which did help. No ants or bugs, and all appliances worked.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Raisehell
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous after I booked a week here through Interval. I usually do all my research ahead of time, but I didn't do any research until after I booked and was very concerned about what our vacation would look like. I originally booked a one-bedroom unit, but had to call about another Interval reservation and the Interval rep said there was a two-bedroom unit available so he reserved that for me instead. When we arrived, the desk staff was very nice. I was tired after a long day of driving and they realized that and quickly got me all the information I needed. I was pleasantly surprised that we had a room on the ground floor with a patio. Much to our daughter's delight, our patio went right out to the mini golf course. I'm accustomed to beach properties as my parents have a large private home on the Caribbean and I've vacationed at some pretty exclusive beach locations around the world. There are some things I have experienced, no matter what level of resort I've been at...I've had a scorpion in my bathroom at the Ritz; I've had a cockroach in my room at the Atlantis; I've been stung by jelly fish on the beach outside my resort in Mexico. Based on the reviews of the Grand Seas, I was prepared to be overwhelmed by bugs, malfunctioning appliances, dirty rooms, etc, and I was surprised that this was not the case at all. My daughter is deathly afraid of bugs and she is always on the prowl, but we had not a single bug in our unit during our entire week. Our appliances worked perfectly. The ice maker pumped out ice to keep our drinks cool all week. Our jacuzzi tub was awesome. My husband thought the bed was a bit firm, which I actually liked, and I thought the pillows were a little too fluffy, which he actually liked. The bedroom our daughter had bordered the parking lot and I was concerned about the noise as she is a very light sleeper, but she slept straight through every night without a problem. We went to the on-site restaurant one night for tacos, but the tacos didn't look that appetizing, so we walked across the street to Ruby Tuesday's instead. We did have lunch one day in the restaurant and it was good and the staff was very nice and efficient. The tile floor does for some reason make your feet dirty. We put two hand towels down on the floor in two places in our unit and that seemed to keep our feet cleaner. We did the timeshare sales pitch, which I always agree to (and my husband hates!). My parents own with seven different companies and I manage their properties and this program is one of the worst I've seen. We didn't buy and I will say the free promotions they give you are the cheapest I've ever seen as well. But, it was just a small bit of time during our fabulous week. We walked the beach every day, built sandcastles, soaked up the sun, played mini golf, listened to the karaoke on Friday night, and watched our daughter delight in playing in the pools. Overall, we had a perfect week!

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Ian H
Reviews.Content: Looking at their web site the property appeared very nice. This appearance was far from the truth. We had a two bedroom unit which was small and uncomfortable. A small table attached to the wall was all we could eat from. There were bugs all over the place requiring the pest control company to come and rectify. The kitchen was dirty with some of the appliances not working. We were on the ground floor which had the advantage of having a patio adjacent to the children's play area. The upper floors have no balcony. The second bedroom, which was not en-suite, was against the walkway to the car park, and as people started walking by with their baggage as early as 4.30 a.m., it was impossible to get a good night's sleep. The front desk staff tried their best to help, but to no avail. It appeared that the cleaners did not clean beneath anything, nor above eye level. Although we had two rooms, we were only allowed one parking place. Our recommendation is "Stay away at all costs".

Reviews.Title: “Interval failed us twice this year...”
Reviews.Author: Megan H
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my 5 star resort room right now. Its nasty. The floors are gritty, we are on the 5th floor. The couch is stained, the corners are dirty and there are tiny ants in the kitchen. The kitchen is set up horribly and the overall feel of the room is dirty. There is long white hairs everywhere and dark hairs in the tubs. I LOVE the resturant. The man that works down there is so friendly and is really good with the kids. Nothing looks like the pictures. The beach is covered in seaweed and my 3 and 5 year old were stung by man o wars right outside on the beach yesterday. I asked the lobby what it was that stung them and they had no idea. I had to take them to the ER and have them treated then had to tell the lobby what it was that did the stinging. Treating a man o war sting as a jelly fish sting can be lethal. I just don't like being lied to when we are driving all the way from Michigan and then get here and its nothing like they said. I am very thankful though that there were not roachs and the beach is beautiful. Overall we are making due because apparently being a member of the timeshare for 20 years gets you crappy condos but I will say this I hope they get their acts together and stop lying so people can actually enjoy their trips instead of being upset about them.

Reviews.Title: “Only Murphy bed in the room!”
Reviews.Author: ashi88
Reviews.Content: Very uncomfortable murphy bed only! 10am checkout; you are charged for an extra night after 11am. Internet is in the lobby only. Poorly maintained property. On the plus side, the hotel is right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Moondogge
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointing rooms. Never felt like the room was clean. Good location and pools though. If you could get a good deal not a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Room location”
Reviews.Author: pokiemom
Reviews.Content: We exchanged through Interval International and was given a room with no view of anything except the parking lot. It was merely an old hotel room converted to a timeshare. The bedroom was located on the second level and there was a steep, winding stair case to go up to the bedroom. The appliances in the kitchen were old. There were ants. We exchanged a 5 star 2 bedroom for this and should have at least been assigned to a decent room. It would have been much cheaper for us to just stay in a cheap motel and not even pay timeshare and Interval international fees. The only good thing was the beach in front of the resort. Our bed was comfortable and they did do a complimentry towel exchange whenever we wanted. The TV broke once and the maintenance man fixed it promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: BeckL
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this is not a 5 start resort - BUT - it is beautiful beach front condo. Indoor and outdoor pools, hot tubs and the staff worked really hard to keep us happy. No balconies except 1st floor units. What I didn't like about the place was the floors... gritty and never felt clean even on first day. Beds are hard as rocks. Towel/linen exchange is available everyday that we were there - so no problem there. We had a great time but never took our shoes off once in the room. I want to give it a great review but just don't claim 5 star when you are really only maybe a 3.

Reviews.Title: “The service at the Restaurant on site was great.Good food good price.”
Reviews.Author: Norman A
Reviews.Content: Our room was small for 4 adults as not much room for hanging cloths. We stayed 7 days and enjoyed the sunrises on our balcony. We used the putt putt course only 9 holes and a little shaggy but a plus. We cooked out on the patio on their grills and we had a great meal. We had to have the gas exchanged and maint. was right there to change it. The pool and hot tube were great. Right on the beach. Check out the restaurant with a breakfast special of $3.75 and the night manager is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip !!! Beautiful Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathi B
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed September 11th 2011- September 18th 2011. We stayed in a one bedroom. Our room was beautiful and clean. We stayed on the first floor and had a cute patio to sit outside, The bed was super comfortable. The room was super clean and we did not see one bug anywhere. We used the kitchen alot.They have alot of shopping across the street. They even have a little casino with slot machines across the street. There is Starbucks across the street with free wifi. We also got wifi in the hotel lobby and Gilligans. If you ask at the front desk or Gilligans you will be hooked up with free wifi. There is also a free computer to use in the lobby. Gilligans has cheap and delicious food and the entire staff at the Grand Seas are wonderful. I can't understand the negative comments. The beach is gorgeous, the pools are immaculate, and the room is beautiful...The all you can eat Crab Night is great !!! You can get extra towels at the indoor pool...We had a very peaceful and relaxing vacation...We are definitely going back !!! Loved the Hotel !!! Couldn't ask for more !!! AAA+++

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bobbq1970
Reviews.Content: Some reviews had me worried but this id an excellent place with lots of amenities like putt putt..pools with slides. Outside refreshments and foods. Staff friendly and very helpful Our grandkids love it...we will go back

Reviews.Title: “Bad room, great pool and beach.”
Reviews.Author: Nanalee5050
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews, but since we were meeting friends and Daytona was in the middle for us we used our points froma time share and booked at Grand Seas. This was the only place we could get on the Florida coast through them. It was billed as a 5 star resort and we were use to quality stays with our time share. This really wasn't even a 3 star. Let me list the problems with the room first: No light bulb in a sofa lamp, the stripping on the bottom of the shower door was hanging by one corner, several wands to open and shut the curtains were missing, the toaster didn't work, the fridge had no light, the kitchen had ants, the sound for the TV in the master bedroom took awhile to warm up, the 1st room we tried didn't have internet,(it was too far from the server) the curtains for the bedroom on the hall were louvered and let in too much light, in the master bath there were no towel racks by the bathroom sink, nor were there any hooks, the shower pressure was very weak the mattresses were poor, and to top it off, there was no DVD player. We had trouble getting a 2nd parking pass even though we had a 2 bedroom and were two families. We understood one pass per unit, but we had originally had 2 one bedrooms and we had switched when we got there. The restaurant on site was nice. They had a breakfast special; 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage 2 pancakes for $3.75. The people in the restaurant got to know you and they were fun. Now.... when you talk about the pool area and ocean, the set up was the best I've seen. There were two large outdoor pools, one with a slide, a circular kiddie pool with a small slide and an indoor pool. The pool chairs were very cheap plastic and did crack easily but there were enough of them and they also had tables with umbrellas. They had a bar in the middle and even tho we didn't use it, it was nice. The ocean was right there. Boom! Down the steps and put out your chair. I had a great time. It was my best best beach trip ever. I liked this pool and beach set up better than any place I've stayed in Sanibel, Sarasota, Pensacola and Panama City Beach. Take what I've said and decide what you need and go from there. For us, even tho the room was bad, we had one of the best vacations ever. (And the part about wear shoes and socks is so true.) I ruined one pair of socks just by walking around the condo.

Reviews.Title: “They tried, but not enough for a 3 star even...”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lovers_YB
Reviews.Content: Stayed first week of September 2011 in room 2046. Looks partially refurbed, new paint, refaced cabinets, new bed covers, etc. No DVD player (really!!) and no WiFi. There was an alarm system in the room and signs everywhere about the CCTVs. Apparently theft is a serious problem. The floor was filthy, there were ants in the kitchen, and I killed a giant cockroach in the bathroom the second night and in the bedroom the fourth night. This is the first time I have stayed somewhere where I bought Lysol to clean and disinfect the place MYSELF. I figured there would be no point to asking them to clean since they apparently do not know how. The bathmat had mold on it and so did the shower curtain (see photos)- had to use Lysol just to get in the tub. Mold in the jets on the side of the tub- did not even consider using the whirlpool- gross. First day had to call maint. to fix the fridge (blown fuse). Responded quickly and fixed it, but when I asked him to fix the bedroom closet door, he just pulled on the door to realign it. The screws could be seen coming out but apparently it was not an option to fix it then. Three or four days later it popped back out. The reason I gave two stars instead of one was the staff and the beach access. View was fantastic. Staff were great, always a smile and a hello, helpful, pleasant. The beach was great, not crowded like the places on either side of us, can see it from the pool; (did not get in the pool since I had doubts about the cleanliness but still a cool feature-looked clean, tho. Decent landscaping. If they could just get the property up to par (really, just clean the room and hire pest control already). Now, just in case someone from their management comes on and says "if only you had informed us..." I shouldn't have to tell you your place is not clean, hire someone to do spot checks, isn't there a supervisor for the cleaning staff checking on their work? The fridge-yes, the door-yes, cleaning-no, I will not advise you. I should have told them abut the non working remote for the tv in the bedroom but I did not want to be bothered by the time I realized it. Food at Gilligan's was decent. Unlike Prevail40, I will NOT be back...

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite place ever”
Reviews.Author: ilive2dive
Reviews.Content: Grand Seas was just OK...its the best I can say. The floor in our room was absolutly disgusting. My feet were filthy from walking on the floor and it wasn't from dirt or sand we tracked in (we were on the 3rd floor) It was better after we asked the time share presentors to have our room cleaned. The view was nice and our room was nice (o ther than the dirt) The resturant food was good and the pools were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the Grand Seas”
Reviews.Author: prevail40
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and we stayed at the Grand seas for 5 nights during the first week of August 2011. The Good: Great facility, love the suite( 2020)we were In, nice indoor and outdoor pool Nice appliances The Bad: Rooms are cleaned once a week Wireless network never worked, TV in the master suite is old, makes a lot of noise, when turn on. Overall, it is not such a terrible place but the sanitary condition has to be better than what is offered. I have never stayed at an hotel or resort where the rooms are cleaned only once a week. We needed fresh towels and sheets, we were told to go and get them ourselves, and that is unacceptable. We are living in a technological era and many of us rely on Wireless Network to do, if not all, but some daily tasks with our wireless devices even when we are a vacation. The wireless network was nightmare. We paid a daily fee of $3 for something that never worked...shame, shame ,shame... My advice to Grand Seas personnel is to take all the guesses' complaints into consideration. I am sure others had complaints about similar issues, however, it is very clear that little has done to improve on the satisfaction of the guesses, otherwise i would not be writing about these issues. it is all about cashing in. I will not say, I will never be back. I have to be back to check on the improvement of the Grand Seas. Once I am satisfied, i can spread the good words.

Reviews.Title: “nice place BUT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clubhill
Reviews.Content: My beef, is that I own that the Grand Seas in Daytona. They only sold a limited amount of Club Navigo time Shares there…. Let me tell you, Grand Seas will not pay the Club Navigo Fees. So I had to wait one year to get a week deposited with II. Now I pay Club Navigo directly for the club fees, BUT I am being charged late fees by the Grand Seas and still I have NO week of time share! So whether they get you up front or on the back end neither of these companies are upright. It took a complaint from me to the BBB of Florida to get a mere $139 payment made that was held hostage. Let me tell you there were many unreturned phone calls and emails. I do own a timeshare with Sheridan (Starwood) and it is a joy to work with these companies. They go out of their way to help! Now I am being held hostage AGAIN by Grand Seas and Club Navigo over $45 late fees of which neither will help me resolve. Sure sucks to take a vacation sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Little TLC but still love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: stubbytoes
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Grand Seas for several years and just love it. Has it seen better days - yes. But am hoping with the new management that things get better. The pool area is awesome. The staff at Gilligans, the onsite restaurant, were the best. They have specials every day. A few were brand new and extremely nice and helpful. You have got to try their steak and potato nght - the steak was awesome (the best seasoning). The girls at the front desk were also very helpful and nice to boot. There were lots of activities for the kids including karaoke - the kids loved singing while the parents enjoyed listening (our poor ears are still ringing...LOL!) My only complaint is that the beds are awful. This is the first year that I slept horribly at the Grand Seas. In the past I have slept like a baby. The beds were as hard as a rock. You could not sleep on your stomach or on your sides - just flat on your back. I think I averaged about 3-4 hours of sleep a night - not good when you are on vacation and need the break from life. So needless to say, getting home and getting a good night's sleep was awesome. I hope the resort addresses the issue with the beds. I was not the only person whe experienced this. The staff said it's their #1 complaint and they plan to remedy it. If the beds are updated - we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Excellent Staff !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bogey001
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the Grand Seas we were greeted by a great front desk attendant whos name was Erin she was friendly,outgoing and knew alot about the area she made our trip great from the get go. The resort was beautiful and had many activities for our family we barely left the resort because it was so much fun, We will definately be back and hope to see the freindly staff there again next year !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wished the rooms were as good as the facility”
Reviews.Author: Spikesgirl87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with our 17 year old daughter who slept on pull-out couch in main area. We all really enjoyed the 2 large, comfortable, clean pools and outdoor jacuzzis. The outdoor bar was good, with drink specials and a good lunch/snack menu at reasonable prices. Access to the beach was great, and the Daytona area was really enjoyable. Room layout was not fantastic, but certainly adequate, especially for a beach resort. From 8 am to 9 pm, the facility was great. A terrible and cruel transformation occurred at night, however, which is a true deal-breaker. We have never slept in accommodations which were so uncomfortable, and that includes several college dorm rooms that I have slept in as a high school counselor! The beds had very thin and rigid mattresses, and we were forced to use the comforter as a matress pad under our sheets, AND we had to purchase two egg crate matress supports for each bed (4 total). Additionally, the main bedroom window faced the exterior hallway and was directky lit by 2 high-beam lights which illuminated the bedroom to afternoon brightness all night long. It was possible to read without turning on any lights in the room ALL NIGHT LONG. Even though wevtruly did have a fun 6-day vacation, we were never so grateful to get home to our own beds! Would love to go back for the facility, but couldn't take a week of tortuted sleep. :(

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT... WILL GO BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: DDM43
Reviews.Content: We were invited to stay and see the travel club presentation. IT WAS GREAT!! Had a 2 bedroom... very spacious. Full Kitchen and living room area. No washer/dryer yet had one around the corner we had to pay for:( Grounds were BEAUTIFUL!! Great pools and stones throw away from the beach. Sometimes the food service was a little slow and tiki bar person was not nice... yet, that was OK... we were on vacation:) Travel club presentation was worth it.. but, didn't buy.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Menden1
Reviews.Content: My wife, granddaughter, daughter and I stayed at this resort for seven nights. This was a terrible place to stay. They charged $3.00 per day for internet, coffee and a paper. I was able to get a signal three times in the whole week, never did get a paper. Twice I went down for a cup of coffee, once the coffee pot was empty, the other time it was very cold. At first they tried to put me in a room that didn’t have any bedroom windows, and the front faced the parking lot. In addition, the side faced a busy street. I gave up a “Five Star” resort on Marco Island for this dump (thank you Interval International). I went to the front desk and nicely told the manager that the room and location was unacceptable and was not going to work. The manager searched the inventory and found us an ocean front room on the 5th floor. Although we were going to have to move on Saturday night; I could deal with moving one night. The front desk staff was very helpful in trying to accommodate us. When I went down stairs to discuss the non-connect ability of the internet, the front desk staff was apologetic. Our two bedrooms were sold to us as having a “full-kitchen”. I attached a photo of the kitchen. What a joke!! There was no place to store food; you couldn’t even fit the silverware and holder in the drawer. My home resort had a washer and dryer in the unit, the washer at this resort cost $1.75 and dryer was $1.50 a load. There was no change machine. I went to the front desk for change, and they couldn’t provide any change. The front desk told me to go to the restaurant next door and I did. However, the restaurant couldn’t provide any change either. The least this resort could have done was to provide free washer and dryer to their guest. If they felt the need to charge for the machines, there should have been some means of breaking a dollar of five dollar bill. The master shower was nasty. When you walked on the floors your socks turned black. They had a nice flat screen TV, although there was no DVD. There was a desk in the lobby that staffed a few ladies that kept trying to get us to take a tour and join their vacation club; we didn’t want anything to do with it. The resort needed a total renovation, and actually would do best just to tear it down and build something new. The location on the beach was nice, but that was it. On a final note, the parking lot was stupid as well.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah22703
Reviews.Content: This place lies and is a total rip off. Do not stay here. They literally ruined me and my family and friends vacation. I stayed here because they said they could promise me a ocean side room with a balcony and they had free wireless internet. Plus they have a restaurant attached that will deliver like room service. We got there and immediately came the first lie. They do not have balcony's. They were taken off by the hurricanes and never replaced. Than at the end of our stay we had a 33 dollar charge. Why? a 10 DOLLAR charge for delivering food. We had already given the kid a 10 dollar tip but they still charged us to ride the elevator up two floors to our room? Than a 3 dollar room charge A DAY. When we asked what the charge was for they said wireless internet. THEY ADVERTISED IT WAS FREE! Than to top it all off, my parents attended a meeting on this time share type thing. It was 9000 dollars to buy into it and it gave you discounted rooms. The guy selling it claimed to be a travelling salesperson and claimed he lived on a beach and owned 3 vacation homes through this company and said how much he LOVED to be a salesman. When we ate dinner two evenings after that at the in resort restaurant he served us our food as A WAITER! so once again, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Came for surf school, coming back every year!”
Reviews.Author: FLSurfMom
Reviews.Content: Chose Grand Seas because the Daytona Surf School is located on property. Two 11 year old girls with us - both surfers. 100% satisfied with the entire experience, and will do it again next summer. Resort is older, but kept very clean by an extremely friendly staff. A balcony would be nice, but you can open your ocean-view window and sit right there watching the surfers. We chose the 2 bedroom unit - the kitchen is small but complete. Sofabed in the living room is not very comfortable, so bring an air mattress to put on top. There was a laundromat on our floor, just a few rooms away. We got a towel exchange anytime we wanted. Only 1 parking pass is given per unit - so don't come with multiple cars. Parking is a big hassle if you can' get on property.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wedsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel had more bed bugs than people. People were rude.Will NEVER stay there again. Do not waste your MONEY here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but I will not be going back”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl00
Reviews.Content: My trip did not start well at all. I had 2 phone calls with the reservations dept. who told me they were on property, about where I wanted my room. I was traveling with small kids and wanted a ground floor room. I was assured that it would not be a problem. When I arrived on May 27th they were unable to find me in the computer. I had my confirmation with me and showed it to the front desk associate. She said that I was to arrive on the 26th even though my confirmation clearly stated that I was to arrive on the 27th. At this time she finally found me and said that I had a floor on the 3rd floor. I said I was assured a first floor room and was told that they NEVER assure specific rooms. Still not happy but I was willing to make the most of the stay. The rooms DO NOT have balconies. That is one of the reasons that I will not go back. My room was nice. It had everything that I needed. The first night the air conditioner stopped working. I went to the front desk first thing in the morning and a matience worker came and got it started. It was a breaker. I was shown what to do it it happend again. It did twice. At one point when I asked for fresh towel, I was told that it was not my day for the room to be serviced and I could not have any. I spoke to the desk and got some right away. The grounds were very nice. There are 3 pools one of which is inside and one is a kids pool. They ahve 3 hot tubs one of which is inside. The kids pool has a slide but it is monitored by any employees and many many older children were using it. It was not safe for a child under 2 because of this. There is a slide at one of the pools and while the sign said no one over 100 pounds, it was not enforsed. At one point the ladder was broken and they had to fix it because of the larger children and adults that were using it. There are not enough chairs to go around but that is not unusual for any beach hotel. There is a nice play ground. The parking was horrible. I hated to have to move my car because you were lucky to find a space when you came back. They were fully booked but did not have enough spaces for each room. From my observations they do not enforce the parking. One night I had to park on the street a half a mile away because there were no spaces available. Due to health reasons this was very difficult for me. The only thing the desk would say was that they were fully booked. While the rooms were nice, the beds comfortable and the location excellent I would not return based on the parking problems, as well as them telling me one thing on the phone and another in person. While for some this is not a issue it is with me.

Reviews.Title: “Do not know what some are complaining about!”
Reviews.Author: RVMAN02
Reviews.Content: Just checked into the grand seas. After reading the reviews I was very concerned about the room conditions. Yes this is an old hotel but our room 3010 is in excellent condition. It's really a very nice room everything's in good condition. So far all the employees that I've come across are very helpful. So far I give the place a good 4 overall.

Reviews.Title: “Inside was terrible outside was great.”
Reviews.Author: MKAT2011
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 5-star as Interval Intntl has it listed. The inside was dirty, outdated, no balconies at all, furnishings old and stained, very small rooms, towels felt like rough sandpaper and very thin. The outside was much better, on the beach, nice pools and good play areas for children...but we had no children with us. Nice location with shopping plaza across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Rooma2000
Reviews.Content: bar tender at the pool was very rude, some staff are rude. they try to sell time share but they present themselves very poorly. certainly not worth the money spend to stay there. think twice before u go.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Resort?? Interval Int'l, have you been here lately?”
Reviews.Author: MarianGH
Reviews.Content: I can't add much that hasn't already been written by other reviewers. But if you decide to stay here, the important things are: 1) DO NOT expect a 5-start resort, then you won't be disappointed. Why does it miss the mark? All the upper floor windows looking out over the ocean and pool are filthy. Our condo's (5003) floor was gritty and dirty upon arrival. The narrow exterior walkway on the 1st floor is grim and the elevators are slow. The rooms have no balconies. 2) The pool is packed on the weekends during spring break because locals slip in through a gate and over a fence. However during the week the pool isn't packed. 3) The fitness center is a big disappointment because all the equipment is old. What's good about the place? 1) Great for families with children. I watched many small children squealing with delight in the playground and kiddie pool. 2) The beach goes on for miles and is great for runners/walkers. 3) The pool bar sells the most outrageously large and powerful rum drinks for only $10. One of those and all your concerns will be forgotten!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Premier resort!”
Reviews.Author: SSISteve
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through Interval International as a time-share exchange. We always pick Premier resorts, as our home resort is a Marriott Premier Resort, and we are always satisfied as long as we stay with major brands, such as Marriott or Hilton. They rated this resort as an equivalent Premier resort, so we thought we'd give it a try. Boy were we surprised! We had a 7-day vacation booked and checked out after 1 night to return home. Trust me, this is not a Premiers resort, or 5-stars. Don't be fooled. It's ok if you're used to 3-star hotels, and it is right on the beach, but if you're used to high quality skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star but, not that bad. Please read my testimony”
Reviews.Author: tommynbrooke
Reviews.Content: Arrived to Grand SeasResort march 18th for 8 nights. I was very scared after booking my stay after reading all the bad reviews that I found at Trip advisory. We absoluly loved the resort, great location, beautiful beach and pretty nice rooms. I never saw the first bug and or roaches. We were lucky enough to get a patio room which made things even better. they have plenty of amenties to keep any child busy all week, my son actually liked the kiddie pool with water slide the most. The huge jungle gym was also a hit. Even in march monday thru friday they have activites for all ages including free manicures for ladies every tuesday and thursday as well as bingo. They have face painting, bowling , games on the beach, ice cream and etc. I dont consider this resort a 5 star by no means maybe more along the lines of a 3 to a 3.5 star. The place does need some remodeling but personaly we try to stay out of the room as much as possible. My biggest problem with the resort which really isnt that bad is the nasty floors, they dont look dirty but after walking around with your bare feet for a day or so your feet will be black. The mantience department isnt very friendly either. Front desk people were amazing though. We plan to go back hopefully next year

Reviews.Title: “What a TERRIBLE Place-couldn't pay me to stay-Total Scam!”
Reviews.Author: SusannPatrick
Reviews.Content: Was invited to take part in a tour and told about several freebies that would be received after the tour. Went in, waited and then told that because of our address and driver's license we were not the type of people they wanted for their tours. We were given a $20 gift card to replace the $20 we provided the day before to hold our spot for the tour. After asking for further explaination, nothing better was given other than we were in the wrong "color scheme" that they place everyone in. What in the world?!? Have gone to time share things in the past and this was horrible! Will be reporting them everywhere we can! The place in no where near 5 star and not even in the best beach location! Run down, nasty looking once you get past the lobby. I would never recommend this place to anyone! Choose Motel 8 before this place!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Interval Internat'l standards!”
Reviews.Author: mkb048
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location in February 2011. I was embarrassed that we invited another couple to join us for part of the week. We are owners of Marriott properties and have exchanged to several other properties but have never encountered a location that was this run down. The front lobby gives a beautiful appearance; however, the rooms and bathrooms were very old style. Grout was very dirty on the tile floor, it appeared that it was original 40's or 50's formica on the countertops. Dishwasher and kitchen were limited. Bathroom tile was dirty and there was crumbling dry wall areas in the bathroom from dampness. It appears to be a converted motel. Looks like it needs to be torn down. Beach was fine and view gorgeous, but please be aware that it's less than pristine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but too many roaches live there!”
Reviews.Author: LiveLife72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grand Seas Resort with 5 families for the weekend back in October 2010. We have a very large family and had to plan for several months to get all of us together in one place at one time. My sister in-law went to the property first to check it out. She was shown "renovated/remodeled" rooms and was told that we would all have similair rooms like shown. My husband and I arrived first. The front desk staff (two very young women) were unfriendly and bordered on rude. Once we reached our room on the 3rd floor it was evident that this was in no way a remodeled room. It was clean (for the 1st night) but looked very shabby. The bathroom showed cracked tiles and worn off paint in some places. As other family members arrived they had the same type of rooms. One room the door would not lock properly, the new room then had a broken air conditioner. Another family had a roach in their room! Even though these family members got new rooms, all the rooms still showed lots of ware and tear. The 2nd night of our stay I went to move a piece of luggage in the bedroom and had a huge roach crawl out from beneath it. Later that night I opened the cabinet in the kitchen only to find another roach. I find this unacceptible for ANY hotel! On the positive side the location is right on the beach and they have severaI pools inside and outside that are very nice. Unfortunately I still wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone for any reason!

Reviews.Title: “love this place, view of the beach from every room, had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: showhome
Reviews.Content: great location across from the Bel Air Shopping center, Publix, Walgreens, Tcby, anything you could want or need.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: northernusa
Reviews.Content: hotel was pretty clean had a lot to offer for kids right on the ocean the bad is all of the people trying to sell you the timeshare week for 17000 and 400 tax/main per year i dont want to be bothered on vacation

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: cgree53488
Reviews.Content: A 5 star resort! Not. Check out the photos. Walked into these cock roaches the first night. They continued all week long. One crawled up my pajamas standing right outside the door. The 2nd bedroom had a dorm refrigerator that kicked off and on all night long. The plantation shutters did not meet either side of the window which caused extreme brightness. The pools and the outside were fantastic as well as the restaurant Giligans! The rooms however, need extreme makeovers! No balconies either! The third photo is the couch which we had to cover in towels and blankets.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel, but needs Improving”
Reviews.Author: disney55555
Reviews.Content: Every year my family goes to the Grand Seas. We simply have a wonderful time everytime we come. Although, when we went to check in, the staff members were so rude, but our room sight was beautiful. The furniture was comfy except for the part that some of the blankets were in the closet and not already set up. The walls had no craks and the layout and decorations were beautiful. The floor was a little wet, so we had to use a carpet. The bathroom was very nice when the towels were already prepared for us. Over nights in our room, there were no rats, but there was a little bit of roaches that crawled around the floor. Our beds was so high up that the roaches couldn't get on our beds. It was raining for at least an hour for a day, but the rest of the days were sunshine. When we went swimming, the pools had red fleas and ants that bit us as soon as we got in the pool, but the staff took care of it right away. One of the hot tubs wasn't working, but they were extremely relaxing with no dirt coming out of it. There were a little lovebugs in the hot tub so we had to get them out. The staff paid no attention to that. The laundry service was simply outstanding. All of our towels were clean and fresh. They had some very fun kid activities, but I think they should come up with better ideas. My daughter wanted to play Survivor, but it turned out that you had to stay in the pool and do a bunch of tricks. They had lively entertainment and fabulous food, but I think they should drop down the prices at the Gilligans resturant. When we tried to get our bags in our room, our cart kept jerking into different directions and made terrible squeaking noises. The floors outside the room were very dirty and turned our feet black. The beach was simply lovely except for the part there was a little litter, but other than that it was beautiful. It is absolutely beautiful at night. So, the Grand Seas needs a little improvements, but it's a fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Healthydecisions360
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Seas of couple of times and it has always been nice. Once there was some construction going on to take care of hurricane damage but is there EVER a good time for constuction at a resort/hotel???? There are some very nice rooms and there are some that are in the process of being made nice. Is this a five star resort, no, is it a nice family friendy resort that is ideally located in Daytona Beach, YES! I have read some pretty bad reviews, but I have stayed there multiple times and I have always liked it. I would give it a thumbs up, stars, whatever, but I know I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have listened to the bad reviews, maybe 1 Star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gpulliam
Reviews.Content: My title should say it all...I stayed there for a Labor Day vacation. On the first day, the floors were so dirty that my son's feet were black on the bottom after only playing for 1 hour! The second night, while sleeping in the bed, I was awakened at 11 pm by a roach crawling up my arm and a huge palmetto bug was also on the floor-2 different kind of bugs!! They moved us to a different room, but who could sleep after that! I called Interval International the next morning and had them move us to a better resort 10 miles away. The bathroom was moldy, the ceilings were peeling and there is not enough parking with no lights in the "south" lot at night. After our traumatic ordeal, we were "compensated" with $20 gift certificates to the restaurant-like after seeing roaches in the bedroom would make me want to eat at the restaurant. The pools and oceanfront location is nice, the only plus. The whole resort needs to be torn down and rebuilt. For those that stay at Motel 6, Econolodge, or Super 8 motels, this may be a nice place, but it is definitely NOT a 5 star resort!!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ameyrob
Reviews.Content: After booking and THEN reading these reviews, I was a little hesitant to take my family here. Thankfully, I might not be as finicky as other reviewers might. I found the Grand Seas to be very beautiful and relaxing. The building was older but who cares. There wasn’t lush carpet or grand furnishings but it was simple and clean.
